name: belligerently
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving in a way that shows a wish to fight or argue: Witnesses said he did not act belligerently. She was belligerently skeptical.
formal in a way that relates to fighting a war: They were belligerently building up troops near the border. Leaders of both countries seemed to be heading belligerently towards confrontation. See
belligerent
More examplesFewer examplesHe belligerently flouts the rules.These telemarketers belligerently insist people buy their products. The movement has a nationalist element that is belligerently militaristic.
